com.uber.autodispose

Class ObservableScoper<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.uber.autodispose.ObservableScoper<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the stream type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.reactivex.functions.Function<io.reactivex.Observable<? extends T>,ObservableSubscribeProxy<T>>
    Deprecated. 
    Use the static factories in AutoDispose. This will be removed in 1.0.

    @Deprecated
public class ObservableScoper<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements io.reactivex.functions.Function<io.reactivex.Observable<? extends T>,ObservableSubscribeProxy<T>>
    Entry point for auto-disposing Observables.

    The basic flow stencil might look like this: 

    
   myThingObservable
        .to(new ObservableScoper(...))
        .subscribe(...)

    There are several constructor overloads, with the most basic being a simple ObservableScoper(Maybe). The provided Maybe is ultimately what every scope resolves to under the hood, and AutoDispose has some built-in understanding for predefined types. The scope is considered ended upon onSuccess emission of this Maybe. The most common use case would probably be ObservableScoper(ScopeProvider).
